title: UPDATE 1-Chipmaker Microsemi offers to buy PMC-Sierra in $2.4 bln deal
text:
(Adds details, shares)
Oct 19 (Reuters) - Chipmaker Microsemi Corp offered to buy PMC-Sierra Inc in a deal valued at about $2.4 billion, trumping Skyworks Solutions Inc's offer of $2 billion.
PMC-Sierra's shares rose 14.7 percent to $11.75 in premarket trading.
PMC-Sierra designs semiconductor equipment and provides software services for enterprises, cloud data centers and telecom carriers worldwide.
Microsemi's offer of $11.50 per share represents a premium of about 12 percent to PMC-Sierra's Friday close..
Under the terms of Microsemi's offer, PMC-Sierra shareholders will get $8.75 in cash and 0.0736 of a share of its stock for each PMC-Sierra share held.
Microsemi said the offer values PMC-Sierra at about $2.2 billion, excluding PMC-Sierra's net cash balance as of June 27.
Apple Inc supplier Skyworks said on Oct. 5 that it would buy PMC-Sierra for $10.50 per share in cash. (Reporting by Kshitiz Goliya and Devika Krishna Kumar in Bengaluru; Editing by Kirti Pandey and Anil D'Silva)
